wikipedia_page.main: Charles Thompson (1791–1843) was a British wood-engraver, who made a career in France.

response: * Charles Thompson (jazz) (1918–2016), American jazz musician also known as "Sir Charles"
* Charles Thompson IV, birth name of musician Frank Black of the Pixies
* Charles Thompson (Cherokee chief) (died 1891), (Cherokee name Oochalata), Principal Chief of the Cherokee Nation
* Charles Thompson (American football) (born 1968), former quarterback of the Oklahoma Sooners
* Charles Thompson (rugby union) (1874–?), British rugby union player
* Sir Charles Thompson, 1st Baronet (c. 1740–1799), British admiral
* Charles Thompson (engraver) (1791–1843), English wood-engraver in France

His younger brother, Charles Thompson (1791–1843), was likewise an engraver. Charles studied under the Newcastle engraver John Bewick, the younger brother of Thomas Bewick; the latter produced the predecessor to Yarrell's handbook, also named History of British Birds (first published 1797–1804). Charles won a gold medal for his illustrations in Paris in 1824.
